es.prodevelop.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.jdbc.oracle
Class OracleSpatialDriver

java.lang.Object
  com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.DefaultJDBCDriver
      es.prodevelop.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.jdbc.oracle.OracleSpatialDriver
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.hardcode.driverManager.Driver, com.hardcode.driverManager.IDelayedDriver, com.hardcode.gdbms.engine.data.driver.GDBMSDriver, com.hardcode.gdbms.engine.data.driver.ObjectDriver, com.hardcode.gdbms.engine.data.driver.ReadAccess, com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.core.ICanReproject, com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.IVectorialDatabaseDriver, com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.IVectorialJDBCDriver, com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.VectorialDriver, com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.edition.IWriteable
public class OracleSpatialDriver
extends com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.DefaultJDBCDriver
implements com.hardcode.driverManager.IDelayedDriver, com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.core.ICanReproject, com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.edition.IWriteable

Vectorial driver to access Oracle databases geometries Should work on Oracle Locator. It contains switches to test different modules to perform the translation oracle structs --> gvsig geometries: - Parsing the structs directly. - Using Oracle's JGeometry static methods - Using Geotools utilities (currently, the driver parses the structs directly)

Author:
jldominguez
